channel.title: Help?
channel.description: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Hey guys, i've been trying to play mopar for a while, i used to play back in the day but then i stopped. I never had trouble connecting to servers back then, but now its all about downloading the clients, and im sure this question gets asked ooo so much. I've used google, and tried to find any help whatsoever but i just can't. I'm sure its easy to figure out, i downloaded mopar 3.2 and also have the webclient 4.1...i'm just not sure how to get into a server. i know all about the status checker and what not, but when i download the client for the server im trying to get into where do i put it in order to play? i really do appreciate the help, thanks guys.

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Stupit:

When you download a client click run.bat and then when the login screen comes up, put in a username and password.

Now, Stupit is that very thorough?

[quote=“Instant Kill, post:1, topic:349264”]--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hey guys, i’ve been trying to play mopar for a while, i used to play back in the day but then i stopped. I never had trouble connecting to servers back then, but now its all about downloading the clients, and im sure this question gets asked ooo so much. I’ve used google, and tried to find any help whatsoever but i just can’t. I’m sure its easy to figure out, i downloaded mopar 3.2 and also have the webclient 4.1…i’m just not sure how to get into a server. i know all about the status checker and what not, but when i download the client for the server im trying to get into where do i put it in order to play? i really do appreciate the help, thanks guys.[/quote]

First head over to www.Moparscape.org/serverstatus.php

Take a look at the Sponsored Servers, scroll down and you’ll see all of the servers sponsored by Moparisthebest.

If you scroll down more you have a bunch of options.

All you have to do is click and see the information, such as if they need you to download a client, or use a webclient, etc.

Pm me if you need any additional information.

Read full topic

item.title: Help?
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

When you download a client click run.bat and then when the login screen comes up, put in a username and password.

Read full topic
